dss.description: Assisted Onsemi by web scraping articles that could help them identify their standing against other companies.
Currently helping the Madison Fire Department by creating a web application that would allow them to track their inventory.
Currently helping ClearView to create a database and web application to allow the organization of their work orders.

description.para: Worked with the BYU-Idaho Computing Team to create a basic web application that will help students hold a list of projects.
Currently working with the team to create a website for the Computing Society.
Transferred data from AWS to Google Cloud using Cloud Run Functions and listeners running on a Cloud Compute Engine VM
Created a ticketing system to help keep track of orders
Mentored approximately 1000+ students by helping others learn concepts in the Intro to Databases, Web Fundamentals, and Intro to Cloud courses
Created a 2 hour Concept Workshop helping students prepare and succeed in final exams
Taught various topics such as database normalization, ERD creation, CRUD, CSS grid, HTML, JavaScript
Integrated the AWS system students use for classes in the CSE Department
Learned Spanish (Fluent). Had interactions with people through teaching and service
Discovered how to love the people, work hard, and live within a tight budget
Ascertained how to work with different personalities
Planned, raised funds, and assembled emergency backpacks for Sexton Mtn. Elementary School
This involved raising over $1,000 and coordinating twenty volunteers

projects.name: Holes Are Bad
projects.description: Collaborated with a team as configuration manager and acting team lead using C# to create a fully functional game that has a title and an end screen

projects.name: Auto Grader Program
projects.description: I created a program that will help teachers and TAs grade assignments for the ITM 111 (Intro to Database) class at BYU-Idaho.

projects.name: Film Database Frontend
projects.description: Created a frontend for a database that students were working on to show the importance of using primary keys in every table.
